meanings.definition: A loud, unrestrained cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The little girl let out a bawr when she dropped her ice cream.
meanings.sent2: The bawr of the crowd could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: During the scary movie, there was a sudden bawr that made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: His bawr of frustration echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The bawr of the thunderstorm was so intense, it shook the windows.

meanings.sent1: The baby started to bawr when she was hungry.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but bawr when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent3: The cat began to bawr loudly for attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees bawr in the storm.
meanings.sent5: He would bawr in frustration when things didn't go his way.

meanings.definition: A bar or rod used for support or reinforcement.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used a sturdy bawr to hold up the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: She leaned on the metal bawr for support.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used a thin bawr to balance on the tree branch.
meanings.sent4: The bawr across the doorway prevented anyone from entering.
meanings.sent5: The bawr of the bridge creaked under the weight of the cars.
